items.sentence: Why don\'t you give us a couple of days to think it over?
Why don\'t you tell us a little something about yourself?
Why don\'t you wait in the car while I go into the store?
What\'s the safest way to get to the top of the mountain?
I thought you\'d eventually realize Tom didn\'t like you.
Tom and Mary look really good together, don\'t you think?
Tom had no idea why Mary didn\'t want to go out with him.
Tom had forgotten his umbrella so I lent him one of mine.
Tom has decided to stay in Boston for another three days.
I think we should use our time a bit more constructively.
Tom spent the remainder of the night thinking about Mary.
Tom spoke to Mary in French, but she answered in English.
Tom spoke to the person sitting next to him on the train.
Tom started to unfold the piece of paper Mary handed him.
Tom strung up a hammock between two trees and took a nap.
Tom suggested to Mary that she apologize and make amends.
I could probably get used to having Tom for a son-in-law.
I thought I told you not to buy anything from that store.
I wish I could figure out how to convince Tom to help us.
I didn\'t realize that Tom had never gone to high school.
I didn\'t realize that Tom wanted me to do that with him.
I didn\'t really think there was anything to worry about.
I didn\'t want to say anything that might make Tom angry.
A man who never makes mistakes is a man who does nothing.
A passport is usually necessary when you travel overseas.
According to statistics, world population is on the rise.
Are you still driving that car your grandfather gave you?
Tom caught a mosquito between his thumb and first finger.
Tom cautiously pushed the door open and entered the room.
Tom certainly came out of that mess smelling like a rose.
Tom certainly seems to enjoy reading books by Mark Twain.
Tom has been experiencing severe headaches and dizziness.
Tom heard something and turned around to see what it was.
Tom arrived ten minutes ago, but I haven\'t seen him yet.
Tom arrived ten minutes ago, but I haven\'t yet seen him.
French isn\'t as difficult to learn as some people think.
Have you ever asked Tom why he doesn\'t enjoy doing that?
The train was so crowded that I had to stand all the way.
The tree in front of the library was struck by lightning.
There are lots of presents underneath the Christmas tree.
I wish I hadn\'t eaten the sandwich that Tom made for me.
I wonder why Tom didn\'t stay in Boston for another week.
I\'d like to borrow about three hundred thousand dollars.
Sometimes I wonder if I shouldn\'t have stayed in Boston.
The classroom was so noisy I didn\'t hear my name called.
There are too many people here. Let\'s go somewhere else.
It\'ll be difficult for me to sing this song in that key.
It\'ll take a little time to get used to wearing glasses.
It\'s amazing how much time it takes Tom to wash his car.
The only person who could\'ve possibly done that was Tom.
